verses.text: Keep silence before me, O isles; and let the people renew \add their\add* strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment.

Who raised up the righteous \add man\add* from the east, called him to his foot, gave the nations before him, and made \add him\add* rule over kings? he gave \add them\add* as the dust to his sword, \add and\add* as driven stubble to his bow.
He pursued them, \add and\add* passed safely; \add even\add* by the way \add that\add* he had not gone with his feet.
Who hath wrought and done \add it\add* , calling the generations from the beginning? I the LORD, the first, and with the last; I \add am\add* he.
The isles saw \add it\add* , and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.
They helped every one his neighbor; and \add every one\add* said to his brother, Be of good courage.

So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, \add and\add* he that smootheth \add with\add* the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It \add is\add* ready for the sodering: and he fastened it with nails, \add that\add* it should not be moved.
But thou, Israel, \add art\add* my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.
\add Thou\add* whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said to thee, Thou \add art\add* my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.

Fear thou not; for I \add am\add* with thee: be not dismayed; for I \add am\add* thy God: I will strengthen thee; yes, I will help thee; yes, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
Behold, all \add they that were\add* incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that contend with thee shall perish.
Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, \add even\add* them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of naught.
For I the LORD thy God will hold thy right hand, saying to thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Fear not, thou worm Jacob, \add and\add* ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the LORD, and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat \add them\add* small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.
Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the LORD, \add and\add* shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.

\add When\add* the poor and needy seek water, and \add there is\add* none, \add and\add* their tongue faileth for thirst, I the LORD will hear them, \add I\add* the God of Israel will not forsake them.
I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah-tree, and the myrtle, and the oil-tree; I will set in the desert the fir-tree, the pine, and the box-tree together:
That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the LORD hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
Produce your cause, saith the LORD; bring forth your strong \add reasons\add* , saith the King of Jacob.

Let them bring \add them\add* forth, and show us what shall happen: let them show the former things, what they \add are\add* that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or declare to us things to come.
Show the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye \add are\add* gods: yes, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold \add it\add* together.
Behold, ye \add are\add* of nothing, and your work of naught: an abomination \add is he that\add* chooseth you.

I have raised up \add one\add* from the north, and he shall come: from the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon princes as \add upon\add* mortar, and as the potter treadeth clay.

Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? and before time, that we may say, \add He is\add* righteous? verily, \add there is\add* none that showeth, verily, \add there is\add* none that declareth, verily, \add there is\add* none that heareth your words.
The first \add shall say\add* to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
For I beheld, and \add there was\add* no man; even among them, and \add there was\add* no counselor, that, when I asked of them, could answer a word.
Behold, they \add are\add* all vanity, their works \add are\add* nothing: their molten images \add are\add* wind and confusion.
